summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 discussing the handling, copying, and transfer of hard drives containing productions (likely evidence) for the case US v. Epstein. It references work by a vendor to stamp and export data from a Relativity database, and mentions a planned extension request to Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge to whom an extension request regarding the production timeline is planned to be made.

events.title: Discussed Production Deadline
events.description: A date that had been discussed as a potential deadline for the production of evidence, though an extension was being planned.

keyFacts: Hard drives containing productions (likely evidence) for US v. Epstein were received and needed to be copied or sent out.
A vendor was actively stamping and exporting data from a Relativity database, breaking the production into seven parts.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was involved in coordinating this evidence handling, with multiple contractors mentioned.
An extension to a production deadline was being planned for submission to Judge Nathan.
The email chain shows logistical coordination for evidence management in the Epstein case years after his death.
